record.isolationSource: Spleen of a common seal (Phoca vitulina)
record.isolationComments: Isolated from the spleen of a common seal (Phoca vitulina)
record.comments: Brucella pinnipedialis B2/94. Brucella pinnipedialis B2/94 (NCTC 12890; BCCN 94-73) was isolated from the spleen of a common seal (Phoca vitulina). This strain is the type strain and will be used for comparative analysis with other Brucella species.

record.isolationComments: Isolated at a depth of 2500 m from the Sulu Trough
record.comments: Photobacterium profundum strain SS9.This is the type strain for the species. It was isolated at a depth of 2500 m from the Sulu Trough. The genome contains 15 rRNA operons; the majority of which are on chromosome 1. There are 2 ATP synthase operons; one on each chromosome. Chromosome 1 contains more conserved genes; while chromosome 2 contains a large proportion of unique genes. High-pressure adaption has been studied by microarray analysis (ArrayExpress - E-MEXP-210).

record.isolationComments: Strain IMCC9063 was isolated from a surface seawater sample collected off the coastal region near the Dasan Korean Arctic Station in Ny-Ã…lesund, Svalbard,

record.isolationComments: Isolated from a surface seawater sample from the Western Pacific Ocean Margin (East Sea of Korea),

record.collectedBy: Facultad de Ciencias:Universitat de les Illes Balears;
record.isolationComments: Isolated from sediments of the West Mediterranean Sea. Enrichment and isolation. Samples of upper (2 to 3 cm) Mediterranean sediment were taken from an area offshore (0.5 to 2.5 km off the coast; depth, 10 to 40 m) from Barcelona, Spain. This area is strongly polluted by industrial and urban wastewater.
record.comments: Pseudomonas stutzeri CCUG 29253 (P. stutzeri AN10) is a well characterized naphthalene degrading bacterium isolated from sediments of the West Mediterranean Sea. Although it is able to grow with naphthalene and/or salicylate as unique carbon and energy source; salicylate seem to be toxic for strain AN10 at concentrations higher than 3 mM. Evolutionary experiments to adapt strain AN10 to higher salicylate concentrations are now underway.

record.isolationComments: This strain was isolated from the epidermis of Alvinella pompejan
record.comments: Nautilia profundicola AM-H. Nautilia sp.strain AM-H; also known as Nautilia profundicola; was the first published Epsilonproteobacterium to be isolated from hydrothermal vents. This strain was isolated from the epidermis of Alvinella pompejana.
Obtained from Oncorhynchus mykiss
Previous name was Enterococcus seriolicida

record.isolationComments: Isolated from the mud recovered from the depth of 11;000 m in Mariana Trench
record.comments: Pseudomonas sp. strain MT-1 is the first-identified deep-sea denitrifier isolated from the mud recovered from the depth of 11;000 m in Mariana Trench. We report the genome sequence of this bacterium; which contribute to the understanding of denitrification and bioenergetics in deep sea.

record.isolationComments: The new organism was isolated from chimney samples collected by the submersible Nautile during the cruise â€˜Guaynautâ€™ in 1991 in the Guaymas Basin [Gulf of California (27u 019 N, 111u 249 W)] at a depth of 2616 m. The vials were then closed tightly with butyl rubber stoppers and stored at 4 uC until used for further experiments

record.comments: Thermococcus sp. Strain ES1 is a hyperthermophilic archaeon isolated from a Paralvinella sp. polychaete worm collected from a hydrothermal vent on the Endeavour Segment in the northeastern Pacific Ocean

record.isolationComments: The new isolate was obtained from a sample of an active black smoker collected at a depth of 2420 m at the Kairei vent field (25u199 S, 70u 029 E) on the Central Indian Ridge.The chimney fragment was collected by the ROV Jason and was placed in an isolated container for the trip to the surface. Subsamples of the chimney fragment were ground in a mortar and the slurry was stored under an atmosphere of nitrogen at 4 degree until used as an inoculum

record.comments: Thermovibrio ammonificans HB-1. The isolation and characterization of microorganisms that are thermophilic; anaerobic; and chemolithoautotrophic (getting energy by oxidizing inorganic compounds) is critical to understand the ecology and biogeochemistry of geothermal environments. This genome will be used for comparative analysis.

record.isolationSource: Flat; laminated microbial mat in a salt marsh
record.isolationComments: In sandy intertidal sediments of the Great Sippewissett Salt Marsh on Cape Cod (MA, USA), Â¯at, laminated microbial mats of unusual thickness regularly developed. During the sampling period in the summer of 1986, these mats were about 10 mm thick and comprised four to Â®ve distinctly coloured layers
record.comments: This strain will be used for comparative analysis.

record.isolationComments: A marine isolate from a deep sea sediment collected from the Sea of Japan
record.comments: Verrucosispora sp. AB-18-032 is a filamentous bacterium belonging in the Micromonosporaceae family of the Actinobacteria. It produces abyssomicin (inhibitor of para-aminobenzoic acid biosynthesis which is an precursor of folic acid) and proximicin (furan-containing peptide with weak antibiotic effect and strong antitumor properties)

record.isolationComments: http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.aquaculture.2005.07.031
record.comments: V. nigripulchritudo is responsible for mass mortalities of shrimp in New Caledonia. The analysis of the genome sequence of one strain; SFn1 (realized by the Genoscope); genetic approaches and molecular epidemiology led us to suggest that plasmids and chromosomal elements played a role in the emergence of a pathogenic lineage. Through genome sequencing of 15 additional strains this project will yield insight into the key features underlying virulence; and will investigate whether horizontal gene acquisitions have driven the differentiation of virulent lineages.

record.isolationComments: Here we announce the complete genome sequence of V. parahaemolyticus BB22OP, a Bangladesh environmental isolate from the early 1980s (9). This strain, with an O4:K8 serotype, has been extensively studied with respect to swimming and swarming motility, biofilm development, and phase variation.
record.comments: Vibrio parahaemolyticus is a foodborne pathogen that is a major worldwide cause of gastroenteritis. Here we report the complete; annotated genome of the prepandemic V. parahaemolyticus strain BB22OP that has been extensively studied for its motility; quorum sensing; and phenotypic switch between opaque (OP) and translucent (TR) phenotypes.

record.isolationComments: Samples were collected from mollusk-harvesting areas located in the northwest of Spain

record.isolationComments: Isolated a marine agarolytic bacterium using L-AHG as a sole carbon source from a decomposed grapsid crab (Grapsidae) collected from the coast of the West Sea (Incheon, South Korea).
record.comments: The Vibrio sp. EJY3 can grow using 3;6-anhydrogalactose as a sole carbon source.Using this competency; the expense of carbon source for industrial products could be reduced.

record.isolationComments: This strain was isolated from Pacific Ocean marine sediments at a depth of 630 m.
record.comments: Shewanella sp. W3-18-1. This strain was isolated from Pacific Ocean marine sediments at a depth of 630 m. Shewanella are facultatively anaerobic, Gram-negative bacteria, motile by polar flagella, rod-like, and generally associated with aquatic or marine environments. . They are capable of using a variety of compounds as electron acceptors, including oxygen, iron, manganese, uranium, nitrate, nitrite, fumarate, to name but a few. This ability makes Shewanella important for bioremediation of contaminated metals and radioactive wastes. The genus Shewanella comprises 36 recognized and hundreds of uncharacterized cultivable species.

record.isolationComments: Strain MIT 00-7128 was isolated from the faeces and gastric fluid of a captive Beluga whale in the Mystic Aquarium, Connecticut USA, which was displaying symptoms of lethargy and loss of appetite. It was found to have esophageal and forestomach ulcers. While it has not been proven these bacteria cause gastric ulcer disease H. cetorum does appear to be associated with gastritis (adapted from PMID 12454148).
record.comments: Genome sequencing of new helicobacter species from animals; their comparison to Helicobacter pylori from humans. Gastric isolate from beluga whale from Mystic Aquarium in Connecticut.
record.sequencingCenters: Dept. Molec. Microbiology; Washington University Medical School in Saint Louis

record.isolationComments: Isolated from tilapia in Costa Rica
record.comments: Genome sequencing of the emerging fish pathogen Francisella asiatica isolated from tilapia in Costa Rica. Emerging problem in fish culture worldwide; including the US; Costa Rica; Latin America; Hawaii; Taiwan; Norway; Chili; and Japan.

record.isolationComments: Aeromonas salmonicida (strain A449) was isolated from a brown trout in the Eure River, France in 1975 and harbors one chromosome and 5 plasmids. Comparison to the related A.hydrophilia ATCC 7966 (AERHH) show the presence of numerous insertion sequence, some of which are still active and various other mobile elements lreading to substantial genome rearrangements. A.salmonicida is no longer mobile and has also recently lost a type IV and type VI secretion systems, thus probably avoiding the host immune system. It seems to be undergoing genome decay and adaptation to its specific host (adapted from PMID 18801193).
record.comments: Aeromonas salmonicida subsp. salmonicida A449. Aeromonas salmonicida subsp. salmonicida A449 was isolated from a brown trout with furunculosis.
record.sequencingCenters: National Research Council Canada - Institute of Marine Biosciences

record.comments: Aliivibrio salmonicida LFI1238. The genome sequence of this strain will provide information on infectivity and pathogenicity of this organism.

record.comments: Pseudoalteromonas atlanticaT6c. Pseudoalteromonas atlantica T6c(ATCC BAA-1087) was isolated from a biofilm from San Diego Bay in California. The genome of this organism will provide information on the production and regulation of compounds involved in biofilm formation; shell degradation; and virulence.
To understand the degradation mechanism of this strain

We represent the complete genome of M. lutaonensis strain CC-HSB-11; which is the type strain of the species.

record.isolationComments: isolated from flounder (Paralichthys olivaceous); is presented
record.comments: Vibrio anguillarum is a Gram-negative bacterium associated with hemorrhagic septicemia disease in farm and wild fish around the world. The complete sequence of Vibrio anguillarum strain M3; a serotype O1 clinical strain isolated from flounder (Paralichthys olivaceous); is presented.

record.collectedBy: Japan marine science and technology center
record.isolationComments: Isolated from deep sea sediment of the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean and belongs to a closely related group of thermophilic Bacillus spp.
record.comments: Geobacillus kaustophilus strain HTA426. Geobacillus kaustophilus strain HTA426 was first isolated from deep sea sediment of the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean and belongs to a closely related group of thermophilic Bacillus spp. Lambda-phage inserts from Geobacillus kaustophilus strain HTA426 and Geobacillus stearothermophilus strain HTA462 have been sequenced and compared.

Brucella ceti has been reported as the etiological agent of several chronic diseases in cetaceans. B.ceti isolates; even if belonging to the same specie; present distinct genetic traits and host preferences. In 2012; several Stenella coeruleoalba animals have been found dead on Adriatic Sea costs. Post mortem analysis revealed the presence of the B.ceti in their brain tissue. The aim of the study is the deep characterization of the isolates to clarify genetic relationship with already described B.ceti types: porpoise; dolphins and human types; since they display variable virulence and infectivity in hosts; including humans. Host_age: Adult

The genus Alteromonas contains species of marine bacteria that have been isolated often from the oceans around the world. Based on the phylogenetic analysis of 16S rRNA gene sequence similarities; strain DE170 was classified as another member of the genus Alteromonas with 99% of 16S rRNA gene sequence identity to the recently described Alteromonas australica H 17T(Ivanova et al; 2013). This study aimed to provide a detailed genomic investigation of the two A. australica strains obtained from two geographically distant locations.

Brucella ceti has been reported as the etiological agent of several chronic diseases in cetaceans. B.ceti isolates; even if belonging to the same specie; present distinct genetic traits and host preferences. In 2012; several Stenella coeruleoalba animals have been found dead on Adriatic Sea costs. Post mortem analysis revealed the presence of the B.ceti in their brain tissue. The aim of the study is the deep characterization of the isolates to clarify genetic relationship with already described B.ceti types: porpoise; dolphins and human types; since they display variable virulence and infectivity in hosts; including humans.

record.isolationSource: Arabian Sea at a depth of 50 meter
record.comments: Prochlorococcus marinus str. AS9601.This cyanobacterium was collected in the Arabian Sea at a depth of 50 meters and isolated by filter fractionation. It belongs to Clade HL-II; the most abundant group in the North Atlantic and North Pacific Oceans; often constituting over 90% of the total population. Strain AS9601 outgrows MIT9312 in temperatures exceeding 28oC; and can grow at significantly higher temperatures.
record.sequencingCenters: Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation Marine Microbiology Initiative|J. Craig Venter Institute

record.comments: Rhodococcus sp. strain B7740 is a Gram-positive yellow-pigmented bacterium commonly found in the Arctic seawater. The genome sequence for Rhodococcus sp. strain B7740 is presented here to provide genetic data for a better understanding of its carotenoid -accumulating capabilities.

record.isolationComments: Deep-sea hydrothermal vents
record.comments: Over the past 30 years; countless microorganisms exhibiting various metabolisms and physiologies have been isolated from deep-sea hydrothermal vents. One of the more recent isolates; Aciduliprofundum boonei; is the first true acidophile to be isolated from deep-sea vents and is the sole described isolate of the deep-sea hydrothermal vent Euryarchaeota group 2 (DHVE2). The DHVE2 have been detected at vent sites from around the globe using molecular surveys of 16S rRNA genes and appear to be endemic to the deep-sea. Understanding the metabolism and physiology of this organism through whole genome analysis of A. boonei will allow us to make inferences about the ecology of this unique group. In addition; obtaining a genome sequence of a second member of this group from a geographically distant vent site will allow us to compare these isolates and link differences / similarities to geochemical parameters of the vent fluids.
